title: R Ashwin on Rohit Sharma‚Äôs critics: ‚ÄòWhen will they stop? When he performs‚Äô
content:
Former India off-spinner R Ashwin has raised concern over Rohit Sharma‚Äôs current form and said the Team India captain must silence his critics with his performance with the bat. After an abysmal Border-Gavaskar Trophy, where he dropped himself from the final Test in Sydney. However, Rohit‚Äôs poor form continues as he managed on two runs in the opening game of the three-match ODI series in Nagpur.
‚ÄúThis is not easy. If you look at it from Rohit‚Äôs point of view, then obviously, it is frustrating form him,‚Äù Ashwin said on his Youtube channel.
‚ÄúHe needs to concentrate on the series. He thinks that he have done well in the format and he‚Äôd like to continue that.
STORY CONTINUES BELOW THIS AD
‚ÄúBut people will ask questions. The ones who are watching will obviously ask.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a catch-22 situation. You can‚Äôt stop these questions. When will they stop? When he performs,‚Äù he said.
Rohit Sharma was miffed when asked about his form heading into the ODI series against England. (BCCI)
Earlier this week, Rohit Sharma didn‚Äôt seem too pleased with questions on his current form and his future after the ICC Champions Trophy in the press conference on the eve of the first ODI against England in Nagpur.
‚ÄúWhat kind of a question is that? This is a different format, a different time. As usual, as cricketers, we know there will be ups and downs and I have faced a lot in my career, so this is nothing new to me. We know every day is a fresh day, every series is a fresh series,‚Äù Rohit shot back.
STORY CONTINUES BELOW THIS AD
It was unlike any Rohit press conference one has seen over the years. Even after India were bowled out for 46 against New Zealand last year, the India captain had come for the presser and answered all questions coolly.
‚ÄúHow is it relevant that I talk about my future plans sitting here when there are three ODIs and a Champions Trophy coming up. Reports have been going around for a number of years, but I am not here to clarify those reports. For me, these three games and the Champions Trophy are very important, so my focus is on these games. We will see what happens afterwards,‚Äù Rohit had said.
India will play their second match against England in Cuttack on Sunday.

title: Chances of asteroid 2024 YR4 hitting Earth just shot up: Should we panic?
content:
The chances of asteroid 2024 YR4 impacting Earth, seven years from now, have shot up. The odds have now increased to 1 in 43. Asteroid 2024 YR4 currently tops the risk list of the Center for Near Earth Object Studies Sentry. However, there is still no need to panic. While experts and scientists anticipated the probability of its impact to increase, now they also expect a chance of an impact to decrease considerably in the near future as more comes to light about the asteroid‚Äôs orbit. 
Renowned asteroid hunter David Rannkin precovered asteroid 2024 YR4 with the help of data from the Catalina Sky Survey. Precovered here stands for the process of finding images or data of an astronomical object before its official discovery. Rankin reportedly spotted images of the asteroid in archival data. Earlier this month, the odds of the space rock impacting Earth in 2023 were 1 in 83. This means the chances have now doubled. The latest figure of 1 in 43 essentially shows a 2.3 per cent chance of a strike. ‚ÄúThat means we are still at 97.7% chance of a miss from this asteroid,‚Äù Rankin was quoted as saying by space.com.

content:
As results for the Delhi Assembly elections started trickling in, and BJP edged past the halfway mark as per early trends, Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah Saturday took a dig at his INDIA alliance partners.
The Aam Aadmi Party, which has a lead in 30 seats in the 70-member Assembly at present, and the Congress decided to go their separate ways in the Delhi polls ‚Äì a decision that appears to have benefited the BJP.
In a post on X alongside a GIF that shows a sadhu saying ‚ÄúJi bhar kar lado (fight to your heart‚Äôs content)‚Äù, Omar said, ‚ÄúAur lado aapas mein!!! (Keep fighting amongst yourselves).‚Äù

The Chief Minister has been critical of rifts within the alliance earlier too, stating that if the alliance was only for the parliamentary elections, ‚Äúit should be wound up‚Äù.
He also underscored that if the alliance is also meant for Assembly elections, ‚Äúwe will have to sit together and work collectively.‚Äù
Omar had made these statements while pointing out that the alliance partners have not convened since the Parliament elections.
Although the parties contested the 2024 Lok Sabha poll together, the AAP and Congress have been critical of each other while contesting the Delhi election, where they have been rivals since AAP‚Äôs foray into politics in 2013.
